node.title: ‘Essence of Rio’: Dirty Foot Bars Offer Escape From Inequality
node.description: A cross between a dive bar and a greasy spoon, Rio de Janeiro’s beloved (and proudly filthy) hole-in-the wall joints are some of the most democratic spaces in a deeply unequal city.

node.title: Lewis Hamilton's F1 Team Apologizes to Grenfell Tower Fire Victims for Sponsorship Ties
node.description: Mercedes-AMG Petronas CEO Toto Wolff apologized for emotional harm caused to victims of the 2017 fire after a recent sponsorship announcement drew criticism.

node.title: So you want to be a backyard beekeeper. You, and many others
node.description: Australians are swarming to amateur beekeeping, with the latest figures showing the sector valued at $173.5 million per year. But there's more to the hobby than simply buying bees.

node.title: Another man absconds from Howard Springs overnight, making it five escapees in a week
node.description: Northern Territory Police locate and take into custody a 36-year-old man who allegedly escaped from the Howard Springs quarantine facility overnight.

node.title: Victoria has recorded 1,365 new local COVID-19 cases and nine deaths
node.description: There are now 14,383 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 547 people have died during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Petroleum found in well water near Pearl Harbor, Navy says
node.description: The well has been shut down since Sunday.

node.title: How Can I Stay Me in a Workplace Full of Suits?
node.description: A law student seeks advice on what to wear to work.

node.title: With No Deadline Deal, M.L.B.’s Lockout Begins
node.description: Players and owners continued to negotiate until the final day, but with the sides still far apart, baseball has its first work stoppage since the 1994-95 strike.

node.title: Mexico Seeing Spike in Asylum Applications as Migrants Seek Alternative to Settling in U.S.
node.description: The new plan from Mexico will move migrants across the country to other states and allow them to work legally for a year under a humanitarian visa.

node.title: AOC Calls out Leadership for Not Disciplining Lauren Boebert: 'It's Embarrassing'
node.description: House Democrats this year have voted to strip Republicans Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar of their committee assignments over controversial posts.

node.title: Who Is Shannon Smith? Larry Nassar's Attorney Reps Alleged Oxford Shooter's Parents
node.description: The parents of the teen accused of killing four fellow students went missing hours after they were charged with four counts of involuntary manslaughter.

node.title: Coloradoans Wearing Tank Tops and Shorts in December Wonder Where the Cold and Snow Are
node.description: Temperatures in Colorado and the western U.S. have set record highs this year, with experts worrying about the environmental and economic impacts.

node.title: Nevada Supreme Court Rules Gunmakers Not Liable for Las Vegas Concert Shooting
node.description: A Nevada law protects the gun manufacturers from culpability unless one of their firearms malfunctions.

node.title: Migrant Rights Groups Fear Kidnappings, Extortions in Renewed 'Remain in Mexico' Program
node.description: "We've accounted for numerous cases of kidnapping and extortion, of physical assault, sexual assaults, violence," Marisa Limón Garza, deputy director of the Hope Border Institute, told Newsweek of the conditions people face under the Remain in Mexico policy.

node.title: '100 Confirmed Cases in the World': Boy Diagnosed With Rare Uncombable Hair Syndrome
node.description: 14-month-old Locklan Samples was diagnosed with a rare genetic disorder over the summer. Now his parents are bringing awareness to UHS.

node.title: Alec Baldwin 'Rust' Shooting Interview Unwise, But Likely Not Harmful, Experts Say
node.description: Legal experts tell "Newsweek" the interview may not have served the star well, though they also said it likely didn't hurt him from a legal standpoint.

node.title: Parents of Michigan school shooting suspect charged
node.description: James and Jennifer Crumbley have each been charged with four counts of involuntary manslaughter, prosecutors said.

node.title: Franz Streitwieser, Trumpet Maestro With a Trove of Brass, Dies at 82
node.description: He accumulated more than 1,000 items with provenances spanning centuries, all housed for a time in a converted barn in rural Pennsylvania.

node.title: U.K. Says Minority Groups Dying From COVID at Higher Rates Due to Vaccine Hesitancy
node.description: Vaccination against the virus has lowered death rates among all groups, but Black and South Asian residents of the U.K. die from COVID-19 at higher rates.

node.title: New York City School Finds 21 Weapons With Metal Detector on Day of Installation
node.description: "Weapons of any kind have absolutely no place in our schools," New York City Department of Education press secretary Nathaniel Styer told Newsweek.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation," December 5, 2021
node.description: U.S Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy and more appear on Sunday's "Face the Nation."

node.title: What to Do This Weekend
node.description: It’s best-of season.

node.title: Mother of 5 Gets 4 Years in Belarus Prison, Charged with Creating 'Extremist Group'
node.description: Volha Zalatar was sentenced to serve four years in prison for creating an "extremist organization" when she organized walks and concerts for a local group.

node.title: Bomb Squad Called to Hospital After Man 'Slipped and Fell' on WW2 Munition
node.description: The shell reportedly got "lodged inside his rectum," and he "sought medical assistance after realizing he couldn't get it out."

node.title: 17-Year-Old Arrested Over Alleged Assault of Opponent After High School Basketball Game
node.description: "We emphasize the need for sportsmanship," said the executive director of the Iowa High School Athletic Association after the fight.

node.title: The 2022 AFLW fixture is full of compromises and surprises
node.description: The upcoming season of AFLW features a number of breaks with tradition, including a Frankston opener and an early January start.

node.title: Graves 'not affected' but Isle of the Dead a barometer for climate change at Port Arthur
node.description: The Isle of the Dead, the cemetery of Port Arthur, is a ghostly reminder of Tasmania's brutal past. But it also serves as one of the first sea level benchmarks — and the climate change story it tells is bleak for the future, experts say.

node.title: Parents of Michigan boy charged over Oxford school shooting
node.description: A prosecutor describes chilling moments on the day of the shooting when a teacher found a drawing of a gun, a person bleeding and the words "blood everywhere" at the boy's desk.

node.title: What is the risk of COVID spread from an unvaccinated family member or friend?
node.description: As people gather to celebrate the festive season, health experts say there are measures everyone can take to limit the risk of COVID.

node.title: Trail Blazers fire general manager Neil Olshey after toxic workplace probe
node.description: Olshey had violated the teams' code of conduct, the Trail Blazers said in a statement Friday.
